#400 Meggitt PLC

Industry Focus: Meggitt was known for providing components, sub-systems, and systems for the aerospace, defense…
data.text:
https://lnkd.in/evfmxD2Z #400 Meggitt PLC Industry Focus: Meggitt was known for providing components, sub-systems, and systems for the aerospace, defense, and energy sectors. Their products included sensors, control systems, and other critical components used in these industries. Aerospace and Defense: Meggitt's aerospace and defense products included systems for aircraft, such as flight displays, fire detection systems, and avionics. They also supplied components for military applications, including defense electronics and monitoring systems. Energy Market: In addition to aerospace and defense, Meggitt had a presence in the energy market. They provided solutions for the monitoring and control of critical assets in power generation, including turbines and other industrial equipment. Global Presence: Meggitt operated globally, with a presence in various countries. The company aimed to serve a diverse range of customers in the aviation, defense, and energy sectors around the world. Acquisitions: Companies in the aerospace and defense industry often engage in acquisitions to enhance their capabilities. Meggitt, too, had a history of strategic acquisitions to expand its product portfolio and market reach. https://antharas.co.uk/ https://lnkd.in/eP62zZ_E

Did you know Inovance Technology’s EasyPLC has been shown to perform in the harshest conditions, including extreme heat and cold? ❄️ 🌡️ ⚙️ Our robust Easy Series PLC and GL20 I/O expansion modules underwent a series of rigorous tests by Polish integration specialist Elpesoft, a customer of our Polish distributor Eldar, to see if they could withstand harsh conditions like military field installations - and they were found to perform even in temperatures ranging from -40°C to +85°C. 🤩 🦾 Click the link in the first comment to read the full case study 🔗 #automation #casestudy #PLCs #industrialautomation

Learn about the latest research from the Center for Operator Performance . This will include items related to advanced process control (APC), alarm sounds, and team training. Research on how APC degrades operator skills will be shown with implications for intervention techniques such as simulators or micro-learning. New sets of alarm sounds will be presented that facilitate identification of which console is generating the alarm. Enhanced training for operator-maintenance interactions based upon aerospace and military principles will be explained. Discover more at Emerson Exchange Immerse, Oct. 3-5. Register here > http://emr.as/GR8050Pv2LF #WhyExchangeImmerse #RegisterToday #software #analytics #petrochemicals #refining

How has #Avionics hardware certification evolved over the years, and why is DO-254 now essential for ensuring quality? In the past, Avionics hardware was considered simple, but times have changed. Discover the transformation in Avionics hardware certification and the crucial role of DO-254 in our white paper, "DO-254: Costs vs. Benefits" 👉 Get the white paper: https://lnkd.in/gnrWueju DO-254 demands meticulous planning, consistency, and thoroughness in requirements, design, documentation, and testing. It relies heavily on testing to ensure project and systems quality, but true quality comes from a solid process, design, and implementation. And when it comes to quality in aviation, DO-254 is a must, no matter the aircraft or application. #AvionicsCertification #DO254 #Aerospace #EASA #FAA

As people increasingly shift their hobbies and activities to rely on electronic devices, the importance of MIL-STD-1275 power supplies has grown significantly. These power supplies are essential for military operations due to their ability to provide reliable and ruggedized power to critical electronic equipment in challenging environments. They ensure safety, reliability, and compliance with military standards, making them a vital component for various military platforms and applications. What is MIL-STD-1275 power supplies? MIL-STD-1275 power supplies are designed to meet the electrical requirements outlined in the MIL-STD-1275 standard, which is essential for ensuring the reliable operation of electronics in military vehicles. Winmate offers reliable performance through MIL-STD-1275-compliant power supplies, ensuring consistent and dependable power delivery to attached electrical and electronic equipment in mission-critical situations. Additionally, we also provide long-term product support and reliability, which is essential for military and industrial applications where equipment may need to remain in service for extended periods. Read more: https://lnkd.in/gFuZ5uM3 #powersupplies #defense #electrical #rugged #powersystem

Exciting news from Canadian avionics leader, AEM (Anodyne Electronics Manufacturing Corp.), as their cutting-edge MTP136D forest service radio achieves critical certifications from the FEDERAL COMMUNICATION COMMISSION (FCC) and Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED). Tony Weller, AEM’s Sales and Marketing Director, expresses satisfaction with the milestones, noting their significance in the radio's journey towards formal acceptance by the United States Forest Service (USFS) and an impending Supplemental Type Certificate (STC). Purpose-built in collaboration with the USFS and aerial firefighting operators, the MTP136D is a Project 25 Phase 1 compliant VHF FM radio, ensuring seamless digital and analog communication across the 136MHz to 174MHz frequency band. Key Features of the MTP136D: - Supports 40 zones and 5000 channels - Large NVIS-compatible screen for critical information display - Extended transmit duty cycles for continuous operation - Intuitive menu-driven interface for user-friendly experience - Front-face USB-C programming for custom configurations loading This robust radio is already in use across North America, enhancing communication capabilities in demanding firefighting environments. #AvfoilNews #AEM #MTP136D #ForestServiceRadio #AviationTech #FCCCertification #ISED #FirefightingTech #STC #AviationInnovation

DO-178C defines control coupling as "the manner or degree by which one software component influences the execution of another software component". When it superseded DO-178B, the requirements for the validation of control coupling were extended to include dynamic analysis. This #article explains why it is considered to be so important. https://lnkd.in/e5G2U_f5 #safety #security #aerospace #DO178C #Compliance #Avionics #Software
